meanings.definition: To support and move something from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: She was carrying a heavy box up the stairs.
meanings.sent2: The ants were carrying food back to their nest.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was carrying an umbrella, pretending it was a tree branch.
meanings.sent4: The river was carrying debris downstream after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind was carrying the scent of flowers through the air.

meanings.definition: To have something with you as you go from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: He was carrying his backpack on his shoulders.
meanings.sent2: The child was carrying a balloon at the birthday party.
meanings.sent3: The penguin was carrying a fish in its beak, looking quite proud.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was carrying across the park, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent5: The music was carrying memories of childhood, filling the room with nostalgia.
